a.content:
\sqrt2,\sqrt{2\sqrt2},\sqrt{2\sqrt{2\sqrt2}},\dots

is equivalent to

2^{\frac 1 2}, 2^{\frac 1 2 + \frac 1 4}, 2^{\frac 1 2 + \frac 1 4 + \frac 1 8}, \dots

The exponent part is geometric series that converges to 1. Therefore this sequence converges to 2.

q.content:
Does the sequence

\sqrt2,\sqrt{2\sqrt2},\sqrt{2\sqrt{2\sqrt2}},\dots

converge? If so, find the limit.

path: answers-db/books/Understanding Analysis/2. Sequences and Series/2.4 The Monotone Convergence Theorem and a First Look at Infinite Series/2.4.3/b
